item.title: Free Climate Data Platform to Offer Sneak Peek at COP28
item.description: Businesses working on how to report their sustainability data are focused on the handful of mandatory reporting standards coming from regulators around the globe, but there is another project that might be worth watching—the net zero data public utility, or NZDPU.

item.title: Remy Cointreau Earnings Drop on U.S. Headwinds
item.description: Remy Cointreau confirmed its recently-downgraded sales guidance for fiscal 2024 after it posted a sharp decline in sales and earnings in the first half and said it had implemented cost-cutting measures to mitigate short-term adverse market effects.

item.title: SAS Losses Widen on Higher Costs
item.description: SAS reported a much bigger-than-expected loss in the fourth quarter on a weak Swedish krona and high jet-fuel prices, but reported revenues just above views and said it expected to get approval in its Chapter 11 process in early 2024.

item.title: Decline in Inflation Expected to Limit Upside in German Bund Yields
item.description: A decent drop in eurozone inflation should limit the upside in German Bund yields, even as front-end valuations look “increasingly ambitious,” Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: ABB Upgrades Financial Targets
item.description: ABB lifted its long-term sales and earnings targets and said around 70% of its group revenue comes from divisions that are growing.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.5%, Boosted by Gains in U.S. Stock-Index Futures
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average rose 0.5% to close at 33486.89, boosted by gains in U.S. stock-index futures and by possible position adjustments ahead of the U.S. October core PCE price index due out later today.

item.title: Why Robinhood Wants British Customers
item.description: Digital brokerages Webull and Public have also launched in the U.K. this year.

item.title: China's Economy Faces Sour End to the Year
item.description: Weakening manufacturing and services activity show stimulus efforts falling short.

item.title: Israel, Hamas Agree to Extend Truce by One Day
item.description: The deal comes after Hamas released a sixth group of hostages on Wednesday.

item.title: Asian Currencies Consolidate; May Strengthen Amid Lower Treasury Yields
item.description: USD/SGD edged lower in the afternoon Asian session ahead of the U.S. October core PCE price index, the Fed’s preferred measure of inflation, which is due out later today.

item.title: Israel Considers How to Remove Threat of Hamas Fighters in Gaza
item.description: U.S. and Israeli officials, citing Beirut precedent, discuss the idea of exiling militants from the enclave.

item.title: What's at Stake at COP28 in Dubai
item.description: Negotiations are set to center on a stocktake of progress in reducing global warming, the future of fossil fuels, financing and a fund to pay for climate damage.

item.title: Why No One Wants to Pay for the Green Transition
item.description: Investors and consumers are balking at the costs of replacing fossil fuels with renewable energy, highlighting the painful economics of climate mitigation.

item.title: OpenAI's new board took over and said it would add an observer role for partner Microsoft, capping a dramatic chapter for the startup.
item.description: OpenAI’s new board took over and said it would add an observer role for partner Microsoft, capping a dramatic chapter for the startup.

item.title: Paul Whelan, a U.S. citizen who has been held in Russia since 2018,was assaulted by a fellow inmate after a conflict at his prison east of Moscow.
item.description: Paul Whelan, a U.S. citizen who has been held in Russia since 2018, was assaulted by a fellow inmate after a conflict at his prison east of Moscow.

item.title: Cigna and Humana are in talks for a combination in a cash-and-stock deal that would create a new health-insurance powerhouse.
item.description: Cigna and Humana are in talks for a combination in a cash-and-stock deal that would create a new health-insurance powerhouse.

item.title: Died: Henry Kissinger, 100, Nobel Peace Prize-winning former secretary of state.
item.description: Died: Henry Kissinger, 100, Nobel Peace Prize-winning former secretary of state.

item.title: The Russian government is proposing a new law to force foreigners entering the country to sign a loyalty agreement restricting what they can say about government policy and social values.
item.description: The Russian government is proposing a new law to force foreigners entering the country to sign a loyalty agreement restricting what they can say about government policy and social values.

item.title: Pressure on the FDIC over allegations of a toxic work environment mounted this week, as the agency's internal watchdog launched its own inquiry and a Republican senator requested records related to settlements and nondisclosure agreements.
item.description: Pressure on the FDIC over allegations of a toxic work environment mounted this week, as the agency’s internal watchdog launched its own inquiry and a Republican senator requested records related to settlements and nondisclosure agreements.

item.title: A U.S. Air Force Osprey aircraft with eight people on board crashed into the sea off southern Japan during a routine training mission.
item.description: A U.S. Air Force Osprey aircraft with eight people on board crashed into the sea off southern Japan during a routine training mission.
